answers.answer: I'm sure as long as you're eating healthy food and gaining weight from that you'll and baby will be fine.

Eat 6 small meals a day and watch your carb intake.  It'll make you feel less hungry.  I had to do this when I got diagnosed with gestational diabetes.  I was gaining alot of weight too fast and as soon as I switched up my eating habits I barely have gained any weight at all.

Prepare snacks so that when you are hungry you eat and you are filled. Pack nuts, like almonds in sandwich bags, grab a fruit/veggie that you can peel or bite in to or pack in a sandwich bag as well and a yogurt if you can keep it down. That helps with the huger and it is healthy.Hope it helps.

question: I'm 34 wks and 2 days and I'm a ftm and also plus size. My Dr said he doesn't want me to gain more than 15 lbs. And I've only gained 10 lbs.. Which is great. But it seems like since about the 33 wk mark I feel hungry all the time! I know my weight is gonna go up.. I guess I just want to know my baby will be ok if I gain more than 15lbs?
title: hungry!
